Encoding Guides

API Version History

API versioning means we can roll out new features and options with less worry about breaking existing integrations. When an update to Zencoder is not backwards-compatible, it'll go in to the next API version, so you can upgrade when you're ready to use it.

Overview

You specify the API version you want to use through the URL your application uses to post to Zencoder - posts to https://app.zencoder.com/api/v2/ use V2. If no version is specified the request will use the edge API where things can change without warning, so only use this if you're experimenting with a new feature before it's officially available, never in production.

API versions will be closed down as new versions come online, and we will always give at least 6 months notice before a version is shuttered so that you have time to migrate your application.

Future API Versions

Version 3 - /api/v3

Details

  • Available: Coming soon!
  • Announced: May 1, 2012

Significant Features

Coming soon!

Edge - /api

Details

  • Available: V3 availability date

Significant Features

  • None announced

Current API Versions

Version 2 - /api/v2

Details

  • Available: September 28, 2011
  • Announced: January 5, 2012

Significant Features

  • Rich notifications
  • Backup storage
  • Progress APIs
  • Reporting
  • Dependent Outputs
  • Transfer-only Outputs
  • Aspera Transfer
  • Conditional Outputs

Discontinuing API Versions

Flixcloud - /api/flixcloud

Details

  • Available: August 1, 2010
  • Announced: August 20, 2010
  • Discontinued: March 12, 2019

Significant Features

  • Flix Cloud API request translation layer

Version 1 - /api/v1 and /api

Details

  • Available: April 1, 2010
  • Announced: April 1, 2010
  • Discontinuing: V3 availability date

Significant Features

  • Initial Zencoder API
